alert.note: Alert for Gregg; Harrison; Panola; Smith; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:12AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SMITH...SOUTHWESTERN HARRISON...NORTHWESTERN PANOLA...RUSK...SOUTH CENTRAL UPSHUR...GREGG AND NORTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 200 AM CDT... At 111 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Liberty City to near Overton to near Troup to near Mount Selman. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, Jacksonville, Henderson, Kilgore, White Oak, Gladewater, Hallsville, Overton, Troup, Tatum, New London, Arp, Clarksville City, Mount Selman, Liberty City, Joinerville, Mixon, Turnertown, Reese, and Lakeport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Texas.
